name: Treasure Island - TI Hotel & Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Treasure Island from August 29 through September 1, 2007. Check in took a while.... there were only two people handling checking in that night but three dealing with people checking out? Thought that was strange. We arrived later in the evening - 10:45 PM - and recieved the room we booked (king bed, strip view, non-smoking).
reviews.title: It was okay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon entering the room I noticed it was nothing special. It was a large room and the view was great but the bed looked like someone had sat on it after it was made - kinda ruffled? There was something similar to peanuts on the floor near the bed tucked under the dust ruffle. The bathroom was also large and fairly clean. I noticed some mold/mildew in the corners of the shower. Maid service was prompt each day, provided clean towels and new bath products daily.
reviews.title: Don't stay here what ever you do

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I utilized the makeup application service at WET spa. I called at the last minute and they were very eager to assit me with an appt - on a Friday night. I was happy with the makeup apllication I recieved and could not complain about the price charged. From what I saw, the spa is quite nice.
reviews.title: Good Hotel on the strip - Great Location

likes.disliked: — No non smoking rooms being available despite booking one

reviews.text: We only ate at the buffet for breakfast. It was only $12.95 and there were LOTS of choices - some very good, others pretty standard. The one place I suggest you eat for dinner - SOCIAL HOUSE. It was amazing. We ate there two nights in a row. Try the mini Kobe burgers - to die for!
reviews.title: reservation requests not guaranteed

likes.disliked: — information on booking on hotel website

reviews.text: Neither my husband or myself were very lucky at the casino, which is okay. You win some, you lose some but where were all the drink girls? We saw one, once!
reviews.title: Very Poor Value - Go elsewhere

likes.disliked: — The room was badly maintained and thus made it very poor value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The TI is an older Hotel in the center of "the strip". The rooms have been modernized and offer any comfort. Unfortunateley, they do not offer free Wifi. The poolarea is a little bit small, but to relax after the obligatory casino-hopping, it's absolutely sufficient. They have some nice restaurants and bars and a great buffet. For us, the TI is the ideal spot to explore the strip. It's located right beneath the Fashion-Show-Mall, opposite to the Venetian and as all the hotels on the strip, they offer free self-parking.
reviews.title: Best value on the strip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at TI from May 22nd-26th. We had a room on the 18th floor that had great decor, it must have been one of the refurbished ones, reading the reviews on here. If you have an iPod (unfortunately we only have shuffles) then bring it because the rooms have stereos that let you plug in iPods. The only other recommendation about the rooms is to make sure you put the privacy sign on the door, because "housekeeping" tried to get into the room 3 mornings out of 4, usually at times before 9am. When we left, we checked out of the room using the quick check-out on the TV and it worked fine.
reviews.title: Fun at TI

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the restaurants, we tried the Coffee Shop, Pho, the buffet, Cantors Deli for one breakfast, and Kahunaville, and enjoyed them all. If you want to drink in the Kahunaville bar then make sure you come down the escalator from the Mirage tram late afternoon/early evening because they were giving out 2-for-1 cocktail vouchers (and I think the food vouchers as well) at the bottom of the escalator to people coming off. It's pretty easy to get hold of Kahunaville food discount vouchers as well.
reviews.title: Ok

reviews.text: It's a very handy location being next to the half price ticket booth in the Fashion Show Mall; we got a deal on Legends in Concert
reviews.title: Had a great stay!!!

likes.disliked: — I just wish I had a room with the view of the strip.

reviews.text: but could have got more. Note that if you buy one of their half
reviews.title: The T.I. is just 'Okay'.

likes.disliked: — The pool was sub par and the nightclub is below average.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were worried that T.I. might be sub-standard considering the pretty reasonable price we paid but were totally satisfied with the experience. Self-parking at the back of the hotel was easy enough although I wouldn't care to drive up the strip again as traffic was appauling! It was a long haul through the casino to reception with our bags and cases, but I think this is standard Vegas judging by the other casinos we visited whilst we were here. The reception was friendly and efficient and we were quickly installed on the 24th floor - this was a surprise as we had paid the standard cheapie expedia rate but had a great view directly down the strip. The room itself wasn't enormous, but was attractively decorated in muted colours with really comfortable beds, crisp linens, flat screen TV and a large bathroom with TI's own-brand spa toiletries (unlike a previous reviewer, these did go in my case - think they have more of a guy fragrance?!). There is a huge range of eateries and shops in the casino itself although the only time we did eat in the hotel was for the buffet breakfast which was good value (kept us going almost 12 hours!); the buffet staff were lovely and the quality of the freshly prepared food was exemplary. Check-out was speedy via the TV. The location of T.I. is a winner and although there were some cheaper hotels on offer, none had the quality/value for money ratio we felt we got here.
reviews.title: Good Value in Vegas
The Spa @ TI great - TI Hotel is horrible don't stay there!
reviews.text: Recently stayed at TI for 3 nights. Started we checked in with our late flight around 9pm. The first room was dirty, bed not made up, iron board out, just like someone had a late check out and they did not clean up. I called and they moved us to another room with queen beds, smoking, no covers on the bed? NOT what I asked for. I was told that this is all they had. I asked if the hotel was totally booked and she responded NO but this is what we can offer you. I informed her that this was NOT ACCEPTABLE and if she went to a hotel and they placed her in a dirty room and then changed her to a room that she did not request would she feeel that she received what she wanted? She replied NO but this is what we can offer you tonight. NO attempt was made to make our stay right. We asked for housekeeping to come up and clean the king bed room immediately. They came up, didnt change the sheets, just strightened up the bed and put the board away. We slept on the covers and melted chocolate on the sheets to assure us they would be changed in the morning. WE SHOULD NOT HAVE TO DO THAT! In this ECONOMY they should be happy someone is staying in their hotel!!! SO DONT STAY AT TI!!!

Now on the other hand...THE SPA at TI.... this is another story. This is our 4th time at this spa and each and every time we have an enjoyable experience. The spa treats you like a king/queen. My wife and I had the Venus and Mars package. I had Jenny for the massage...ask for her, she is about 6 foot tall and the strongest hands I have ever had on my back. Now the Spa knows you have several other options in spas but treat you and thank you for visiting them. Once again we were welcomed like family and treated to a wounderful experience.
reviews.title: Refurbished Petite Suite

likes.liked: — Strip view, comfortable mattress, and flat panel TV

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: STAY ELSEWHERE Go to THE SPA at TI
reviews.title: Good Visit

reviews.text: We stayed three nights at the TI following 2 nights at the MGM Grand. We booked a Petite Suite (we typically book this room type since they do not cost much more than the standard rooms.) The "his" and "her" bathroom is always handy.
reviews.title: Great 3 Days at TI

reviews.text: This was a very mixed bag. Check in was a nightmare. At 3-30pm there was a line that resembled check-in at a major airport on a bank holiday. Hello? Has management not worked out that 3-30pm will be peak time? There were only 2 check-in clerks, with other staff swanning around at half pace, replenishing stationery supplies behind the desks and generally behaving like they were AT a reception rather than ON reception. Must have waited in line for over 30 mins.
reviews.title: Mixed experience

reviews.text: On the positive side, we were upgraded from standard room to a suite, which was really nice. High quality furnishings and bathrooms. The bedroom is separated from the lounge only by a frosted glass screen that only partially shuts it off, so watching tv late is very intrusive to someone else who has retired early.
reviews.title: Nice Casino Hotel

reviews.text: Costs are high in the various eateries, and the quality that we saw did not match. For an expensive suite on the top floor, it is really quite a noisy place at night, with a lot of mechanical noise travelling through the structure, and traffic noise really quite intrusive (we could hear a reversing warning signal from something like a construction vehicle every couple of minutes all through the night). Internet access is rather expensive at an extra $14 per day, but car parking (self park) is really easy, free, and there was loads of room in the car park.
reviews.title: Nice place!

reviews.text: A very disappointing aspect is that the previous pirate show (that we saw and loved some years back) has been replaced by the most awful tacky dance routine that can possibly be imagined. Sack the General Manager for such dereliction of duty. Afterwards we went to Fremont Street to watch the lights and music show, and it was absolutely brilliant. Along with several bands/musicians performing along Fremont St, this made for a very enjoyable evening, and in future we will stay on Fremont St rather than on the newer end of the Strip.
reviews.title: Misleading Website- Rude Staff - Un Accommodating

likes.liked: — the bartenders at the pool were nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've given this one more star than I otherwise would have because of the nice gesture in upgrading us to a suite.
reviews.title: June Trip To The TI

likes.disliked: — Windows in guestroom were very dirty

reviews.text: Treasure Island is a great place to stay in Las Vegas.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Vegas

likes.liked: — The hotel is close to other really nice hotels and the mall

reviews.title: Great "basecamp" for your Vegas fun weekend
reviews.text: It is not the most extravagant hotel on the strip, but it is still nice and clean, great value for the price. It is very close to all the attractions and to the mall. I am very happy we stayed there.

It is right across the street from Palazzo and the Venetian, which really beautiful. And only a short walk from Ceasar's Palace, Paris and Belagio which are also incredible. The fountain show at the Bellagio is breathtaking. Luxor and New York, New York are also nice. Some of the other hotels are not as impressive, so I would not spend too much time there.
reviews.title: Awesome Stay!

reviews.text: Was slightly apprehensive to stay at the TI having walked through many years ago yet stayed and really enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Great Place, great value

reviews.text: It is fairly small compared to some of the other labyrinth like hotel casinos and the pool complex was very clean though small. The guests seemed better behaved than at some of the other hotels as well and the staff very attentive.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel..absolutely loved it!!
beware of intenet access and charges
reviews.text: I stood in line for a half hour to use the internet. How ridiculous is this?

TI is a great hotel - really good service, beautiful rooms, good gaming, food and a fun crowd and I have no complaints except for the availability of internet access. If you don't bring your laptop which you can use in your room (I didn't bring mine because I was on a 3 day fun trip with a friend) you must use the 2 terminals in the lobby that charge $1/min. During my stay, it was just about impossible to access them because of all the people uploading pics to Facebook, plus there were some problems with the machines.
reviews.title: Work staff Not Guest Freindly in all areas

likes.liked: — Idiot, rude, misinformed work staff. Hotel policies not accomodating to guests

reviews.text: The hotel staff couldn't help because the machines are run by an outside vendor. TI has an 'executive center' for internet use, and my friend was able to change her air res. for $5/minute. She paid a bundle.
reviews.title: Amazing value, would stay here again without question!!

likes.liked: — Location and value paid for what received (newly renovated rooms)
likes.disliked: — If must include something, no mini-fridges in rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think it's insulting. Travelers reading this know you can get free internet access in Mongolia and Vietnam, for heaven's sake. Shame on TI.
reviews.title: christmas break at TI

likes.liked: — location and size of room and king bed
likes.disliked: — high drink and food prices and gambling machines were tight

reviews.text: Stayed here Thanksgiving week 2008.
reviews.title: Always a solid choice in Vegas

reviews.text: My teenage boys, husband and I stayed at this hotel while we were in Las Vegas. We had never been to Vegas before and from the maps we looked at, it seemed to make sense to stay in the middle of the strip so that we could sightsee the northern portion one day and the southern another. Treasure Island, or TI as they prefer to be called, was right in the middle and the price was right for the number of stars. We stayed in one of their deluxe rooms. Compared to other hotel rooms across the country it had some remarkable differences. To start, there were only 2 drawers to put clothes (in the armoire under the TV), the soap dish in the bathroom was screwed into the countertop and there was no coffee machine in the room. The may be deluxe for Vegas, but we thought it was unusual. Our room on the 20th floor faced the strip and the TI’s Siren’s show. The show is presented 4 times a night and you will hear the cannonballs and see the flashes of light from the explosions. The hotel has a small pool, which was packed with college kids on spring break on the weekend. In hindsight we would have been better off with a hotel with a better pool attraction. The hotel has a Ben & Jerry’s, Starbucks, and several restaurants from a deli, buffet, diner type, burger Kahunaville and fancy Asian and Italian. The most difficult meal to eat was Breakfast. There were long lines at all the restaurants that were opened the Starbucks, buffet and diner. You could buy a pastry and an orange juice and coffee at the bar. I would recommend instead traveling across the street to the Venetian. There is a food stand/restaurant over there called the Rialto Deli that has a good breakfast for a good price. Also don’t stand in line for the Starbucks in the hotel instead cross the street to the mall and go to the Starbucks there - It’s less expensive and quicker. (This mall also has a variety of places to eat at any time during the day.) In general the service in the hotel was fine. We didn’t have any problems, but no magic moments either.
reviews.title: Just Average

reviews.text: My company hosted an event at the TI this spring and my impression...while they have tried to update this property, it is just not on the level of the other mega-hotels in Vegas. The casino is so smoky that your eyes begin watering and burning within minutes...improvements in their ventilation system are desperately needed... I compare this to the Venetian whose casino with really high ceilings was virtually smoke-free with very clean air. And can I mention the casino kept all of my money...I did not hear the noises of as many lucky jackpot winners as I do at other casinos.
reviews.title: Not up to Vegas standards

likes.liked: — the location near the Fashion Show Mall

reviews.text: The food at the giant buffet was average as you would expect....anytime you can walk in 24/7 and choose from breakfast to pizza, sushi to comfort food, you know they are trying to do too much to do any of it really well. The little deli in the back of the casino had really bad corned beef sandwiches for like $12...pass on those for sure. The best thing I had there was at the all-nite cafe near the lobby...a great won ton soup that was perfect at 2AM.
reviews.title: Great Wedding Chapel

likes.liked: — Very clean, provided toiletries and gave us a non-smoking room
likes.disliked: — no coffee maker in room, had to purchase in the casino whenever wanted a cup.

reviews.text: The room itself was very small but nice and clean. The rooms appear to have been renovated with new furniture and mattresses within a few years. Beware of leaving valuables in the room here. I accidently left an I-Pod in the room (not locked in the safe) and it disappeared. That was my fault.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: One plus - the TI is in a great location for shopping at Fashion Show mall (crossover connects directly to the mall)...plus just across the street are the Grand Canal Shops at the Venetian...
reviews.title: Really liked Treasure Island

likes.liked: — The quality room with strip view
likes.disliked: — The sometimes confusing layout, and lack of late night takeaway tea/coffee options

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I return to TI every year in October for our anniversary. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, even though it is smaller than most hotels on the strip, it gives a very homey feel to it.
reviews.title: Our Favorite, we stay here everytime.

likes.liked: — The room, the food, the casino

reviews.text: The hotel was rencently renovated, I love the new decor. The beds are to die for and the restroom is large enough for 2 people to get ready at the same time.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every stay I book a regular deluxe room (the view is not important to us, as we are hardly in the room for long periods of time, except to sleep) on this trip I asked the lady checking us in if there were any upgrades available and she was able to put us in a panaramic room at no charge, and even though this room was at the end of the hall from the elevator we enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Great Stay at T.I.

likes.disliked: — No Free Internet :-( Starbucks didn't charge the prices on their price list.

reviews.text: Our favorite places to eat here is Kahunaville and The Coffee Shop, in 2007 on our 1st Anniversary we ate at The Palm (Forum Shops) as it was a very good meal, although I have found I can find the same entree (which I have to get everytime we visit) Filet Mignon with lump crap meat and cream sauce, with asparagus at Kahunaville for 1/2 the price with the same good flavor.
reviews.title: I Suggest You Pass on Treasure Island.

likes.liked: — Location on The Strip.....but there are others equally convenient.
likes.disliked: — Misrepresentation of what was included with the package.

reviews.text: The Coffee Shop is great for breakfast and a night time snack, the portions are big so share if your not as hungry.
reviews.title: Solid hotel choice

likes.liked: — location on the Strip, felt comfortable there
likes.disliked: — need more less expensive and healthy food options at all hours of the day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Treasure Island for 5 days . When we arrived, the check in was a breeze. We were invited guests through the player club and checked in was rather fast. Our room was located on the 31 st floor ( which was only accessible by key). We had reserved a deluxe room . Our room was nice. Our view was exceptional. We have stayed in vegas numerous times in the last 10 years, but this view of the strip at night was georgous. Treasure Island is a very nice hotel. Not too overpriced on beverages, food and entertainment. This was our 4 th stay here in 3 years.The only complaint I have is the pool area. It was around 107 each day we were there and the pool was standing room only. They need a larger pool for the size of the hotel. Other than that, our stay was great.
reviews.title: Wonderful view, great hotel
Just OK- nothing to brag about- LOCATION IDEAL
reviews.text: Stayed at TI for 3 nights August 19-22 for the first time. Ok room- nothing to brag about. Some mildew smell. Beds were super comfortable. Service was OK- the pool was extremely tiny, and over crowded. Service at pool was very very slow as well as in the casino- played slots for over 2 hours and no one came around with cocktails. Location is great- right in the middle of strip- next to fashion show mall. Would not stay here again. Really enjoyed Bally's or Flamingo- new Go deluxe rooms on prior visits ( this was my 11th time in vegas) Treasure island is just so so. But for $89 bucks a nite was worth it without a doubt. Would be depressed if I paid the usual $150 + a nite here for the regular room.

My family and I made a 2 night stop in Las Vegas on the way to visit some family in Coeur d' Alene, ID. Our 2 girls (7 &9) had never been to Las Vegas. So, this trip was more to treat & expose them to Las Vegas than it was a true "vegas vacation." I had been to Las Vegas several times before and have stayed at Flamingo Hilton, Excalibur, & Paris-Las Vegas. We chose T.I. because of its central location on the strip; but most of all because of the great room rate. At the time of our stay, the temperatures were between 110 - 115 degrees. We arrived at the hotel around noon-ish on Friday, July 13, 2007. The check-in process was very quick, efficient, pleasant and our room was ready at the time of check-in. The room was VERY nice with a GREAT view of the strip! My wife took advantage of the "Wet" Spa and was treated to a color, cut, & style from an extremely experienced, knowledgeable and outstanding stylist. The pool at T.I., as other reviews have stated, is somewhat small, but keep in mind, folks dont come to Vegas for a swimming pool. However, they could benefit by having a larger pool. Although the breakfast buffet was rather pricey, it was very good with plenty to choose from. As mentioned, T.I. is pretty central to everything. It is located next to the mall, which was nice. Across the street is the amazing Venetian. For your convenience, there is a tram that runs between T.I. to The Mirage. During our short stay we ate the buffet breakfast at T.I., had a late lunch at Margaritaville (at the Flamingo Hilton) and an early dinner at America (inside New York, New York). The meals at Margaritaville and America were OUTSTANDING and both were reasonably priced! We took our kids to the top of the Stratosphere for a "bird's eye" view of Vegas! Its truly an amzing view from the top! We also took an indoor Gondola ride. This was nice, but short. I'm still not sure if it is worth the money. Overall, we really enjoyed the trip! Probably not the best vacation spot for kids because of the "adult" environment, but something they will always remember--and that was the idea from the beginning.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel For Your Money!

likes.liked: — Reasonable rates; Central Location on the Strip
likes.disliked: — Price of the meals; Size of the pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at TI for 2 nights on their summer room special.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay at TI

reviews.text: The room was clean, decent sized and the bed was very comfortable. We stayed on the 26th floor, however our view was the back of the hotel and the construction (that we never heard). Not a big deal since we really didn't spend much time in the room - so the free wireless internet was a bit of a waste. The pool area is small, and the chairs are on top of one another, but it was fairly orderly. My only complaint was the bill for drinks at the pool. 2 drinks - 32 bucks!!! OUCH a bit much for foofoo drinks with very little alcohol. Food was marginal at the coffee shop and Kahunaville.
reviews.title: Treasure Island - Great Stay!

likes.liked: — It was right on the strip!
likes.disliked: — It was really a good stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I booked a room at TI because they seemed to have a good rate on a hotel right on the strip plus good reviews on TripAdvisor.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Clean, Comfortable, NOthing Too Fancy

reviews.text: Our stay was nice. We were in a good location right next to the Fashion Square Mall which has a half price show tickets place in it. This was convenient since we wanted to see a few shows.
reviews.title: Great for the money..

likes.disliked: — Charge for internet access, needs better ventilation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was nice, nothing fancy. The bed was super soft and comfortable. The pool was a bit small but we didn't spend too much time at the pool.
reviews.title: The TI is a treasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall the place was fairly low key compared to some of the others on the strip.
reviews.title: Good Location, Nice Hotel, Pool Dissapoints
Good Location fair service
reviews.text: We booked a deal with two $5 starbucks/ben and jerrys coupons, free internet, 10% off at the spa and $20 in casino money.

My sister and I stayed at Treasure Island for 3 nights. The room was nicely decorated and well kept, I have no complaints there. We did have one day where no towels were provided but this seemed to be sorted out fairly quickly. Generally the hotel was fine, but I found it quite impersonal. The pool was filled with people and loud music so there was no option if you actually wanted to swim and relax by the pool. I wouldn't really recommend this hotel to anyone, from what I saw there were better options to be had in Las Vegas.
reviews.title: Not bad, not great

likes.disliked: — The hotel was impersonal and it didn't feel very welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived there for our honeymoon on a wednesday, where we were told we could check in anytime after 3, since checkout is noon and the rooms will no doubt be ready. We checked in at 4, to find out our room wasn't ready. "Betzy" at the counter, who is an assistant manager, told me "Nothing we can do sir, come back every 30 mins to check if its ready". I asked if we could get another room, she said "No, there's nothing we can do". We checked at 4:30, not ready yet. 5:00, not ready yet. 5:20, they finally came over to us and said "Your room isn't ready yet but we got you another". Next morning, at 9:30am, room service walked into our room as we were getting dressed for the day, without knocking, saying "Oh there's someone in this room, sorry to bother you". We came back to our hotel around 6:00pm to get ready for our Mystere show that night, to find our room clean but no clean towels. We had to phone housekeeping, who took 45 mins to bring us 2 clean towels. Worst experience ever, will definitely visit Vegas again, but never stay or recommend anyone to stay at Treasure Island.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel Service In Vegas EVER

reviews.text: Apart from our room the hotel itself is standard and severely lacking character. Our room was big and spotless and had the benefit of having a strip view room. Unfortunately, the hotel itself was let down by a claustrophobic outdated smokey casino with an over crowded party pool. Our room was on the 24th floor and we could still hear the pool DJ from our room.
reviews.title: Not the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I was to return to Vegas, I would pay extra and stay in Caesars Palace or The Wynn. I certainly wouldn't return in a hurry.
reviews.title: Rubbish!!!!!

reviews.text: We stayed here at the end of our roadtrip journey across California, Arizona and Nevada. We only had a few nights here but expected to see it out with a bang. Instead we got a long long long check in, room pillows did not have cases on (as another reviewer also experienced) and NO towels after the first night. We had to wait 2 hours before getting any which delayed us going out for the evening. Housekeeping is rubbish when we phoned them they said "Will try"...what does that mean you may or may not get towels. Phoned front desk and housekeeping about 5 times. At least front desk sent a bottle of champagne up but it took up precious time of our holiday. The bell boys(at front) really can't be bothered especially when we wanted to leave bags after we checked out. I don't think they could be bothered if you had too much luggage, they wanted to make quick bucks for their tips. Very unprofessional, very dissapointing all round. I've stayed in better in Vegas and got better service. This was the worse service in the whole time we were in the USA. STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE especially if time is precious.
reviews.title: I would look elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just got back from a 4 night stay at TI and we had a wonderful time. We had a little bit of a line at check in but they were really good at moving people through and even opened up some more computers to speed things up.
reviews.title: Great Place for the Money

reviews.text: We had a wonderful view of the strip from the 21st floor. The beds truly are amazing and are probably the best part of the room. The TV is a flatscreen but kind of small and not the best quality but who cares. The bathroom was very nice and everything was very clean.
reviews.title: In the centre of it all

likes.disliked: — No fridge and synthetic carpets causing electric sparks when touching lift buttons, OUCH

reviews.text: The Sirens show outside was shut down most of our stay due to high wind. But finally, on our last night, they did the 10:00 show and we caught it just in time. It is a pretty decent show and you get to stand in the front as a hotel guest. Not bad at all for a free attraction.
reviews.title: Great Location.... Very Good Hotel

reviews.text: We saw the Cirque De Soleil show Mystere while we were there. Things are kind of slow in Vegas right now so they gave us 2 for 1 tickets since we were hotel guests. That was a great deal and the show was well worth the money. We loved it.
reviews.title: Excellent Value - Awesome Beds

reviews.text: The casino is pretty typical of a vegas casino. They have plenty of everything you could possibly want. They also have really good food at Kahunaville.
reviews.title: High Class not High Seas

likes.disliked: — Damn connector door let in noise from other room

reviews.title: excellent hotel, perfect holiday!
reviews.text: We stayed at TI for our wedding in October 2004 and found the hotel excellent. we boked early on the internet and got a special rate of $99 per night including tax for a basic room, the room was superb, better than expected, large with a beutiful decor, large bed and luxurious bathroom. Definitely worth the money! The casino was fine, friendly staff, reasonable priecd drinks at the bars. tram to the mirage was good. The buffet breakfast was not open during our stay so the tram came in handy. there is also a Krispy Kreme on site, yum

reviews.title: Will Stay Again!
reviews.text: location is operfect with mirage next door and venitian opposite, and also mall within walking distance for bloomingdales, paul frank store, macys etc etc for any shoppers out there!

reviews.title: Loved TI and Vegas!
reviews.text: would def stay here again and would recommend to anyone

reviews.title: loved TI
reviews.text: My sister and I stayed at TI from 8/22-8/25 and very much enjoyed the hotel! Check in at 9:30 p.m. was very fast. The room was clean and had a wonderful view of the Strip. The remote and door to the tv were broken upon our arrival; however, a note left for housekeeping in the morning and everything was in tip top shape upon our return. Do not rate this hotel based on the show outside. Everything that's free in Vegas is big and cheesy and that is why you visit! Kahunaville was a little too loud for us. The Terrace Cafe food was good, but overpriced. The pool area is large, however, the pool itself is not; however, it was very clean and drinks were easily available. Great location! We'd stay again without hesitation!

reviews.title: Honeymoon Was Wonderful!!
reviews.text: First time to Vegas, it was awesome! TI is great.
We just got back from 2 nights at Treasure Island. I went there with my wife and father in law.
reviews.title: Great Stay at Treasure Island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For our first visit to Las Vegas, I was pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Good deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location:
reviews.title: Mostly fabulous!

reviews.text: The hotel was about in the middle of the Strip, a good distance from everything. In summer however, about 38 degrees celcius outside, it took about 2 minutes walking to the bus stop (at the next hotel), and it was a challenge in the soaring heat. In winter it might not be so bad. Check "The Deuce" on google for details on where the bus stops are. A 24 hour unlimited stops ticket is $5 per person, or you can do single rides for $2 each.
reviews.title: Just what I was looking for

likes.liked: — Extremely Tidy Rooms, decent sized bathrooms
likes.disliked: — That they still allow smoking in the hotels/casinos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Facilities:
reviews.title: Nothing Original

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just returned from an 8 day stay at TI - another fab holiday. Have visited Vegas 9 times in the past six years and stayed at TI for the first time last year for 3 days. We enjoyed our brief visit and decided to stay again this year. We booked a Petite Suite - definitely worth the additional $100 it cost us for the 8 day period. The suites are spacious, beautifully appointed with fantastic beds (the mattresses are to die for), flat screen tv and loads of little extras. His and her bathrooms are a great idea. Disappointed that the Breeze bar was closed due to refurb, however, we were directed to Isla Bar which proved lucky for us - we hit the Royal Flush twice on the poker slots! Casino slots also seemed very generous - again we hit Royal flush on poker slots on casino floor and I hit progressive win of $2500 on a lucky 7s machine.
reviews.title: Great Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited Bills casino for the first time to see their free show, Big Elvis - best free show in Vegas! Casino is old, however, friendly staff and a great party atmosphere made this visit fun. Also visited Golden Nugget downtown to see matinee of 'Defending the Caveman' - great show and again was really impressed by this older casino.
reviews.title: Executive Suite 19-22 May 2008

likes.liked: — The easy navigation in the casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Planet Hollywood Casino definitely worth a visit for those who havn't been since it was Aladdin. The transformation is great, superb design and decor, great music and atmosphere. Ate at the buffet and also at Trader Vics - both places offer delicious food at great prices. Trader Vics food outstanding with a lunchtime view of the Bellagio fountain and loads of people watching! Great!
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.text: Fashionshow Mall just across a bridge from TI - this meant I could just 'pop across' to Macys when I fancied (daily!) .
reviews.title: Good stay, good rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in and check-out no problem. Used laundry service which was efficient and not too pricey. Had room service first day following flight - everything hot and well presented. Bell desk very helpful with bags, shopping and taxis.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Las Vegas
Ti nice place
reviews.text: Just back from 4 nights at TI. First trip to Vegas. Hotel great location. Clean and nicely decorated rooms. Not much of a view, but wasn't in the room much. We stayed on the 11th floor and the sirens show was very loud at night, but it is short. The check in was good, a very long line but moved quickly. Ate at the steak house, good meal prices seemed pretty normal for the area. Would go back again.

My husband and I spent 4 nights at Treasure Island for our 1 year anniversary. Everything turned out to be wonderful. The staff was great. Our room had an incredible strip view, it was clean and very spacious. The best thing about this hotel is the location! I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We will definetly be back.
reviews.title: Awesome Experience
Nice Surprise
reviews.text: My wife and I just got back last night from a 4 night stay at Treasure Island. We had a wonderful time there. We had requested a king room, non-smoking,view, non-connecting, and got none of these upon check in, HAHA . We politely requested again and the next day, got our request with a slight upgrade. The room was very nice with a view of Venetian, Wynn, and fireworks from the Sirens show. Bathroom was marble, bed was comfy, and room service food quality was outstanding. The Sirens show is lame as hell, I don't care that we had preferred viewing vantage points as guests. Auto-shuffle blackjack was annoying but fortunately there was single deck blackjack as well. Morning lines for onsite restaurants etc. are long,including Starbucks. TIP, go past Starbucks, up the escaltor, and to Krispy Kreme for a cup of coffee...NO WAITING !! We would stay there again for sure, especially if we could get a good rate like we've seen during other weeks. Casino wise, our luckiest streaks were at the Paris casino.

reviews.title: Nice first trip to Vegas
reviews.text: We made our first trip to Vegas in June 2004, staying three nights at TI. The weekend rates were very appealing, and the reviews indicated that it would be a good value - and we were very satisfied. We opted for a Tower Deluxe room for an additional $25 a night, which was well worth it - we had a fantastic view looking directly down the Strip. We could even see the fountains at the Bellagio. Early check in was very efficient, even though our room was not ready. There were several folks who provided outstanding customer service: Two front desk clerks worked together to accommodate adjoining rooms with our friends, even though we had forgotten to request them in advance. Our cocktail waitress by the pool was attentive and friendly. The maitre d' at Buccaneer Bay readily accepted us as walk-ins, and even cancelled our reservation in another restaurant in the hotel. We had great meals at Buccaneer Bay, Kahunaville, and Canter's Deli.

reviews.title: TI stands for Trendy Island Not Treasure Island!
reviews.text: The pool is fairly small, and was therefore crowded - not much good for actually swimming. The only bad part of our experience was the loss of a cell phone charger that we left behind - even though we were able to stop by and check on it the day after we left. We did receive a nice letter of apology afterward.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Treasure Island for 3 nights and would not stay there again.
reviews.title: don't bother!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our internet connection never worked properly despite being on the phone with tech support for 15 minutes, and having an engineer visit our room to replace our ethernet cable. In addition, the hallway between our room and the elevators reeked of mildew and garbage. It's a good thing we didn't spend a lot of time in our hotel room.
reviews.title: Good LV break

likes.liked: — Quality of hotel, room views, the bed!
likes.disliked: — Smokers kind of had a better choice of room.

reviews.title: THE TRUTH!
reviews.text: During our stay, I had a massage at the spa and my sister had a manicure/pedicure, which did not live up to our expectations, considering the price of these services.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a very disappointing stay.
reviews.title: Some rough spots but overall good quality

reviews.text: Stayed in TI because of the good price we got through the website. We had picked a penthouse room but as people were able to smoke on that floor in any room when we got there we opted for panoramic room on a slightly lower level. I assume the more you can afford for a room the less rules there are as to whether you can smoke or not. The room was well furnished and I know it has been said before but the bed was amazingly comfortable. We had 2 windows giving us good views but the standard rooms are smaller than the tower room we had at teh Luxor on our last visit. We're not serious gamblers but the casino was much easier to navigate and that goes for the whole hotel really. In comparison to others it is a compact size. The pool was particularly geared towards single 20 somethings at the weekend but quieter during the week. We ate in the buffet one night and to be fair I was quite impressed with the quality and range for the price. If you can get agood deal on price go and have a great time.
reviews.title: Nice hotel...good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at TI back in 2006 and although the hotel was great, on the last day I noticed spots of old dry blood on my sheets and pillow cases - this blood did not belong to me. Upon checkout I mentioned the blood and did not get a response from the woman at the counter. When I returned home I emailed the hotel and was offered a complimentary upgrade to a tower deluxe strip view room if I returned to the hotel. Well I returned to TI last week and was less than impressed again! Firstly when making the booking I was quoted $139 per night but before checking in the rate had dropped to $99 per night however, the hotel refused to lower my rate and I was stuck paying $139. Secondly our room upgrade - what a joke! It was just a standard room with no strip view what so ever. What's the point complaining though right, they clearly weren't too interest in my business. I wasn't disappointed to be checking out 4 days early. My advice, stay at a hotel that values its customers - you can find much higher quality hotels for $139 a night!
reviews.title: Promises Promises...

likes.liked: — Lack of interest in good customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pillows were dirty with lipstick markings, and smelled of body odor. Also, there were no towels in our room. I went to the front desk to complain, and they told me they would send somebody up to take care of it. After 1 hour, nothing was done so I went to the front desk AGAIN, and was told it would be taken care of. I went to dinner, and gambled a bit before returning to my room, and STILL there was nothing done. I went back to the front desk and was told my room would be upgraded in the morning for the inconvenience. This is just the beginnning, it was Labor Day weekend and I paid over $200 for a room where I could not shower due to no towels, and had dirty bedding. The next morning came around and I went to the front desk again to find out when the upgrade would occur, and they told me I would not be getting an upgrade since the suites were sold out (how many times are they going to tell me something and not follow through?). Nonetheless, I stayed there 3 nights only to receive nothing for my inconvenience, and the dirty pillows were NEVER removed or replaced from my room during my entire stay. I am an MGM Players Club member, and travel to Las Vegas often. This was easily my WORST experience at any Las Vegas hotel, and WOULD NOT recommend Treasure Island to anybody.
reviews.title: Overall one of the WORST places I've stayed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned from TI last week after a 4 night stay. The room was nicely updated, bathroom was great, and bed and linens very cozy. The down side of the room was that there was no refridgerator and the vending machine on our floor was out of everything. (plus it was over 100 degrees, so we were thirsty!)
reviews.title: Pretty Good Place

likes.disliked: — No fridge in room and pushy people selling timeshares all over.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One time, an oniony smell came through the vent with the air conditioner. That was unpleasant.
reviews.title: Nice Room, Good Location, But too Much Smoke

reviews.text: Over all, hotel was clean and great for the price.
reviews.title: Rooms Nice - BUT little else

likes.disliked: — Casino is tired and pirates theme dated

reviews.title: AWESOME!!!!!
reviews.text: !st time and not last BEST vacation ever and TI was outstanding. Just got back last night at mid-night. We were in vegas for 5 wonderful days. TI was great the entire staff was great from check in to check out. Rooms were great very large big bathroom. The Steak House was the best steak I have ever had. Canter Deli was great too, The Cafe and Kahoons were wonderful. We ate at The Mirage a bunch of times Califorina Kitchen, The steak place and Itatian too it was wonderful not a bad meal once and we could charge to TI room. The show at TI was great maybe 10-15 min too long. Tips---- buy show tickets at hotel the 10:30 show gives great deals. Join the players club it is linked to MGM, Mirage, Bellagio, NY-NY and more. Use it everytime you gamble ( yes women make your husbands use it) and charge all food to room. At the end of your stay take your bill and players card to window and they will comp you in cash and off your room. We saved over $400.00 got $20.00 in free play and tee shirts. You don't think they comp well during your stay but at the end it pays off. Also, ask if you need something they will make a deal with you. We can't wait to go back. The hotel was quite but busy enough and you can alway take the shuttle to the Mirage or walk to Bellagio for a more elegant evening or NY-NY for more hustle and bustle. TI was priced right and great...... I recommend this to everyone. We will be back SOON......

reviews.title: TI
reviews.text: We arrived at check-in to a queue of about 20 people but we waited no longer than 15 minutes. The staff behind the desk were not overly friendly and the lady who attended to us was making sarcastic comments to another staff member about having to repeat herself all the time to the previous Asian lady who was having trouble understanding. I wasn't impressed with that at all. We were placed in a non-smoking room on the 5th floor and we were very impressed with it. There was no view, but we weren't there to stare out the window so that wasn't an issue for us. We stayed for four nights and were very happy there. It was nice to be just over the road from the large shopping complex. The pool was actually quite large, it just appears small because of all the people. That didn't bother us because we feel that everywhere we went on our US trip was crowded compared to what we are used to at home. It would have been fantastic if the pool area was open later in the evening, but I guess they want you inside gambling and not lounging around outside. You have to walk through the casino to get to the lifts to the rooms and this was a bit unusual for us, particularly if we were returning from the pool in our togs!!! We had a fabulous time walking through all the other casinos too. Wear your comfortable shoes because you walk for miles and miles. Take advantage of the self-parking area as there are plenty of spaces available and you get to your room quicker that way. There are queues everywhere you go, and we had to wait up to half an hour for a coffee at Starbucks (we are just not used to all the waiting). One more thing, we went to see Cirque du Soleil "Mysterie" which was absolutely fabulous at $60.00US each. If we ever return to Las Vegas we will stay at the Mirage next door.

reviews.title: loved ti
reviews.text: I can't believe how nit pickey and....cheap..some of the people who wrote negative comments about ti. You want good sevice you get what you pay for.We stayed at ti in July and were treated like royalty. The service in the casino and cocktail lounge were excellent. I sat down at the same black jack table the second night, and didn't even have to order my drink, because they rembered from the night before what I was having. The pool is small....so what..your in vegas baby they want you at the tables. You want to have a good time at the pool get a cabbana that's what we did...the service was great. You don't go to vegas to pinch pennies and look for everything for free...we will be back at ti for sure...

My husband and I went to Vegas to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary 9/19-9/21 and had a great time. TI is a centrally located hotel on the strip and easy access to anything. Venecian across the street, Fashion Show Mall next door, Mirage on the other side.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: Check-in was fast and friendly. We got there at 11AM and only waited possibly 5 minutes. Upon check-in I asked for a suite which they did not have so I did have to ask again for a possible upgrade. We received a "tower deluxe" room. The room was on the 31st floor facing south onto the strip and we could see the pool, Mirage volcano, Venecian, Eiffel Tower, and even Bellagio fountain with my camcorder. Simply breathtaking! Also the mountains in the morning sunrise was beautiful. The room was spacious and nicely decorated with large bathroom. Was disappointed we couldn't get a petit suite.
reviews.title: Un-buried Treasure
TI = worst place ever!!!!!
reviews.text: It is too generous to even say that this hotel was "OK with just a few problems." This place is the worst! The employees are the most miserable and nasty ppl i think i have ever encountered. I never complain but i am writing this today in attempts at revenge of sorts to the TI ppl. for being so evil.. not that they will care whether you go there or not 'cause they do not care about anything- not even when you get a hair in your 15dollar salad! (yes it did happen) so Please do not consider staying here! go to belaggio, venetian, or paris-theyre beautiful and pleasant.

reviews.title: Great trip to Vegas thanks to the TI
reviews.text: From the minute we got out of the taxi we were bombarded by bell hops at TI who literally rip the bags from your hands despite the fact that the entrance is 10 ft in front of you. I would have appreciated their help if 1. I had a lengthy walk to the room elevators - but they actually are located fairly close to the entrance or 2. if the guy didnt blatantly and rudely request a tip as he was taking the bags from me.

reviews.title: Wheelchair and Service Dog at TI
reviews.text: Little did i know this was just the beginning of a nightmare of a stay at this place. Next incident occured as soon as we entered the room and wanted to lay down in the bed. There were black hairs everywhere in the sheets and pillows.. long ones, short ones, curly ones etc. Maid service came up, barged in the door w.out knocking, never once apologized for any of it. I could go on and on at this point about the rude horrible unbelievable service we got from the staff in the on-site diner and the fancy restaurants too but i will just leave you with this advice: Go to Vegas it is great but***********do not stay at TI *********** you will regret it They are horrible from management down to maintanence. By the way, i submitted two formal complaints to the "president" of the hotel 4 months ago (yes the service was that bad that i complained formally and extensively) and have yet to hear a reply.

We thought the TI was fantastic! We were treated excellent from the moment we checked in to the day we departed. The last time we stayed in Vegas we were at the Bellagio, which was fantastic. So I was a bit wary about staying here. I can't say enough great things about it. Money talks in Vegas, keep this in mind throughout your vacation. If you want a nice room, then dig in your pockets and upgrade. Be realistic about your expectations and what you are willing to spend. We also looked into the possibility of getting a cabana by the pool. The staff there was fantastic, took us on a tour of the area, and recommended that we *not* get a cabana due to sun locations at this time of year. They were honest and kind. All dealers were friendly, helpful, and engaging. The room was spotless and the customer service was phenomenal. We enjoyed a complimentary bottle of champagne because we mentioned my husband's birthday. Anytime we had questions regarding activities outside the hotel, the staff was more than accomodating. The restaurants at the TI...eh. We went off-site for dining. Kahunaville was one big loud headache, we went for a drink, we turned around and walked out. We ate at the 24 hour cafe once- pretty blah, but again, you get what you pay for. There are plenty of excellent restaurants in Vegas, do your research. My only complaint is the Sirens show is really loud- so if your room overlooks that area, be prepared for some noise.
reviews.title: Will Try Other Hotel Next Time

reviews.text: Went to Las Vegas this summer,last time was 32 years ago.It has changed. My wife who uses a wheelchair and travels with a service dog, a 75 pound golden retriever had no difficulty in Las Vegas or at TI We also took her motheer with us. We stayed at TI everything was great. We were even able to rent a scooter for my mother in law at TI. Great servive,friendly and professional employee . We even had an anjoining room without asking. Going back in Dec. Great experience
reviews.title: Loved it.

description: Treasure Island - TI is the AAA Four Diamond resort located on the Las Vegas Strip within walking distance of all the best dining, shopping and entertainment available in Las Vegas. TI features the free Sirens of TI live pirate battle, Mystere by Cirque du Soleil, Gilley's Saloon, Oleksandra Spa & Salon, wedding chapels, tropical pool and cabanas and so much more at very affordable prices.
